alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:07PM MST until July 31 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Bighorn burn scar in... Eastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1015 PM MST. * At 707 PM MST, Thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Finger Rock Canyon. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the Finger Rock Wash basin. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. Pima County Flood Control webcam shows water out of the banks. Flooding of homes along the wash is possible. This is a dangerous situation. Expect signfciant flows moving down Finger Rock Wash. The flash flood warning for the larger Tucson Metro remains in effect with ongoing flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Bighorn Burn Scar. SOURCE...Pima Flood Control and webcams. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Bighorn Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Possibly homes along Finger Rock Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Bighorn Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
